required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Obinutuzumab in Combination With CHOP Chemotherapy Versus Rituximab With CHOP in Participants With CD20-Positive Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (GOYA)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Open-Label Randomized Trial Comparing the Efficacy of GA101 (RO5072759) in Combination With CHOP (G-CHOP) Versus Rituximab and CHOP (R-CHOP) in Previously Untreated Patients With CD20-Positive Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL)

brief_summary.textblock: This open-label, randomized, parallel group study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of obinutuzumab in combination with cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisolone or prednisone (CHOP) chemotherapy versus rituximab (MabThera/Rituxan) with CHOP in previously untreated participants with cluster of differentiation 20 (CD20)-positive diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL). Participants will be randomized to receive either obinutuzumab 1000 milligrams (mg) intravenously (IV) every 21 days or rituximab 375 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) IV every 21 days for 8 cycles, in addition to 6-8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy IV every 21 days. Participants randomized to the obinutuzumab arm will receive an additional two doses on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Anticipated time on study treatment is 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
primary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival was defined as the time from randomization until the first documented day of disease progression or relapse, using a modified version of the Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, or death from any cause, whichever occurred first, on the basis of investigator assessments. Progression was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival was defined as the time from randomization until the first documented day of disease progression or relapse, using a modified version of the Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, or death from any cause, whichever occurred first, on the basis of IRC assessments. Progression was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival in the overall study population was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response was determined on the basis of investigator assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Overall response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, regression of measurable disease, and no new sites.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response was determined on the basis of IRC assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Overall response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, regression of measurable disease, and no new sites.

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete Response (CR) at the End of Treatment, Investigator-Assessed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete response was determined on the basis of investigator assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete Response (CR) at the End of Treatment, IRC-Assessed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete response was determined on the basis of IRC assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to death or disease progression, or initiation of new anti-lymphoma treatment (NALT), whichever occurred first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Event-free survival was defined as the time from the date of randomization until the date of disease progression, relapse, initiation of a new non-protocol-specified anti-lymphoma treatment, or death from any cause on the basis of investigator assessments with the use of Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma. Disease progression/relapse was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by CT/MRI. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to death or disease progression, whichever occurred first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Disease-free survival was defined as the time from the date of the first occurrence of a documented CR to the date of disease progression/relapse or death from any cause on the basis of investigator assessments with the use of Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Progression/relapse was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to death or disease progression, whichever occurs first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: DOR: time from first occurrence of documented CR or PR to disease progression/relapse, or death from any cause for participants with a response of CR or PR. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI. CR: disappearance of all target lesions. PR: >/=50% decrease target lesions in up to six dominant lesions identified at baseline, no new lesions and no increase in the size of the liver, spleen, or other nodes. Splenic and hepatic nodule regression >/= 50%. Progression/relapse: at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 cm or >/= 50% increase in other target lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or any new bone marrow involvement and/or any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. A participant in the Rituximab+CHOP arm with the longest follow-up, 53 months, had an event. The criterion for median was the minimum time when survival went below 50%.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to start of next anti-lymphoma treatment or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to next anti-lymphoma treatment was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the start date of the next anti-lymphoma treatment or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with the treatment. An adverse event can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding, for example), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a pharmaceutical product, whether or not considered related to the pharmaceutical product. Preexisting conditions which worsen during a study are also considered as adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Human Anti-Human Antibodies (HAHAs) to Obinutuzumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (Hour 0) on Cycle (C) 1 Day (D) 1, C4D1, at end of treatment/early termination (up to Month 6), every 6 months thereafter for 30 months (cycle length = 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of HAHAs to obinutuzumab was assessed in the first 100 randomized participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lymphoma (FACT-Lym) Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose [Hour 0] on C1D1), C3D1, end of treatment (up to Month 6), every 12 months thereafter up to data cut-off, up to approximately 4 years and 9 months, (cycle length = 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: The FACT-Lym subscale was developed to assess health-related quality of life in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. The score range is 0-60, with higher scores indicating better outcomes. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) Domain Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose [Hour 0] on C1D1), C3D1, end of treatment (up to Month 6), every 12 months thereafter up to data cut-off, up to approximately 4 years and 9 months, (cycle length = 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: The EORTC QLQ-C30 is a health-related quality of life questionnaire. A higher score indicates better quality of life, with changes of 5 to 10 points considered to be a minimally important difference to participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Concentrations of Obinutuzumab in Japanese Participants With Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: C1: D1 post-infusion and 20-28 and 66-80 hours after end of infusion, D8 and D15 pre-and post-infusion; C2: D1 pre- and post-infusion; C4: D1 pre- and post-infusion; C6: D1 pre- and post-infusion; C8: D1 pre- and post-infusion (cycle length = 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Serum samples for assessment of obinutuzumab serum concentrations were collected only from a subset of Japanese participants following administration of 1000 mg obinutuzumab.

arm_group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

intervention.description: Rituximab at a dose of 375 mg/m^2, administered by intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for 8 cycles.
Obinutuzumab 1000 mg IV infusion, administered on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle for 8 cycles. During Cycle 1, obinutuzumab was also infused on Days 8 and 15.
Cyclophosphamide 750 milligrams per square metre (mg/m^2), administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Doxorubicin 50 mg/m^2 IV, administered on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Vincristine 1.4 mg/m^2 (maximum 2 mg) IV, administered on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle.
Prednisone 100 mg (or equivalent prednisolone or methylprednisolone), administered orally on Days 1-5 of each 21-day cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previously untreated CD20-positive DLBCL
- At least 1 bi-dimensionally measurable lesion (greater than [>]1.5 centimeters [cm] in its largest dimension on the computed tomography [CT] scan)
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0, 1 or 2
- Adequate hematological function
- Low-intermediate, high-intermediate or high-risk International Prognostic Index (IPI) score (low-risk IPI score: IPI 1 irrespective of bulky disease or IPI 0 with bulky disease, defined as one lesion greater than equal to (>/=) 7.5 cm)
- Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) >/=50 percent (%) on cardiac multiple-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan or cardiac echocardiogram
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of severe allergic or anaphylactic reactions to humanized or murine monoclonal antibodies or known sensitivity or allergy to murine products or to any component of CHOP or obinutuzumab
- Contraindication to any of the individual components of CHOP, including prior receipt of anthracyclines
- Participants with transformed lymphoma and participants with follicular lymphoma IIIB
- Prior therapy for DLBCL, with the exception of nodal biopsy or local irradiation
- Prior treatment with cytotoxic drugs or rituximab for another condition (for example, rheumatoid arthritis) or prior use of an anti-CD20 antibody
- Prior use of any monoclonal antibody within 3 months of the start of Cycle 1
- Corticosteroid use of >30 milligrams per day (mg/day) of prednisone or equivalent, for purposes other than lymphoma symptom control
- Primary central nervous system (CNS) lymphoma and secondary CNS involvement by lymphoma, mantle-cell lymphoma (MCL), or histologic evidence of transformation to a Burkitt lymphoma, primary mediastinal DLBCL, primary effusion lymphoma, plasmablastic lymphoma, and primary cutaneous DLBCL

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eleven participants withdrew from the study after randomization but prior to receiving study treatment.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

baseline.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS), Investigator-Assessed
outcome.description: Progression-free survival was defined as the time from randomization until the first documented day of disease progression or relapse, using a modified version of the Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, or death from any cause, whichever occurred first, on the basis of investigator assessments. Progression was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS), Investigator-Assessed
measure.description: Progression-free survival was defined as the time from randomization until the first documented day of disease progression or relapse, using a modified version of the Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, or death from any cause, whichever occurred first, on the basis of investigator assessments. Progression was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

analysis.method_desc: Stratified by International Prognostic Index (IPI) score (low/low−intermediate (excluding participants having an IPI score 0 without bulky disease).

Tumor measurements were obtained by computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

Progression was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

analysis.method_desc: Stratified by International Prognostic Index (IPI) score (low/low−intermediate (excluding participants having an IPI score 0 without bulky disease).

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall survival in the overall study population was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: Overall survival in the overall study population was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR), Investigator-Assessed
outcome.description: Overall response was determined on the basis of investigator assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Overall response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, regression of measurable disease, and no new sites.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.description: Overall response was determined on the basis of investigator assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Overall response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, regression of measurable disease, and no new sites.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

outcome.description: Overall response was determined on the basis of IRC assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. outcome.title: Complete Response (CR) at the End of Treatment, Investigator-Assessed
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete response was determined on the basis of investigator assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. measure.title: Complete Response (CR) at the End of Treatment, Investigator-Assessed
measure.description: Percentage of participants with complete response was determined on the basis of investigator assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Complete Response (CR) at the End of Treatment, IRC-Assessed
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete response was determined on the basis of IRC assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Complete Response (CR) at the End of Treatment, IRC-Assessed
measure.description: Percentage of participants with complete response was determined on the basis of IRC assessments according to the International Working Group (IWG) Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, 2007. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI with or without PET. Complete response was defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Event-Free Survival (EFS), Investigator-Assessed
outcome.description: Event-free survival was defined as the time from the date of randomization until the date of disease progression, relapse, initiation of a new non–protocol-specified anti-lymphoma treatment, or death from any cause on the basis of investigator assessments with the use of Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma. Disease progression/relapse was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by CT/MRI. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to death or disease progression, or initiation of new anti-lymphoma treatment (NALT), whichever occurred first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Event-Free Survival (EFS), Investigator-Assessed
measure.description: Event-free survival was defined as the time from the date of randomization until the date of disease progression, relapse, initiation of a new non–protocol-specified anti-lymphoma treatment, or death from any cause on the basis of investigator assessments with the use of Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma. Disease progression/relapse was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Tumor measurements were obtained by CT/MRI. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Disease-Free Survival (DFS), Investigator-Assessed
outcome.description: Disease-free survival was defined as the time from the date of the first occurrence of a documented CR to the date of disease progression/relapse or death from any cause on the basis of investigator assessments with the use of Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Progression/relapse was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to death or disease progression, whichever occurred first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants, of which evaluable participants were included in this analysis.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Disease-Free Survival (DFS), Investigator-Assessed
measure.description: Disease-free survival was defined as the time from the date of the first occurrence of a documented CR to the date of disease progression/relapse or death from any cause on the basis of investigator assessments with the use of Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Progression/relapse was defined as at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 centimeter (cm) or >/= 50% increase in other target measurable lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or appearance of any new bone marrow involvement and/or appearance of any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. Reported is the percentage of participants with event.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants, of which evaluable participants were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DOR), Investigator-Assessed
outcome.description: DOR: time from first occurrence of documented CR or PR to disease progression/relapse, or death from any cause for participants with a response of CR or PR. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI. CR: disappearance of all target lesions. PR: >/=50% decrease target lesions in up to six dominant lesions identified at baseline, no new lesions and no increase in the size of the liver, spleen, or other nodes. Splenic and hepatic nodule regression >/= 50%. Progression/relapse: at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 cm or >/= 50% increase in other target lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or any new bone marrow involvement and/or any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. A participant in the Rituximab+CHOP arm with the longest follow-up, 53 months, had an event. The criterion for median was the minimum time when survival went below 50%.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to death or disease progression, whichever occurs first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants, of which evaluable participants were included in this analysis.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DOR), Investigator-Assessed
measure.description: DOR: time from first occurrence of documented CR or PR to disease progression/relapse, or death from any cause for participants with a response of CR or PR. Tumor assessments were performed with CT/MRI. CR: disappearance of all target lesions. PR: >/=50% decrease target lesions in up to six dominant lesions identified at baseline, no new lesions and no increase in the size of the liver, spleen, or other nodes. Splenic and hepatic nodule regression >/= 50%. Progression/relapse: at least 50% increase in nodal lesions or >/=50% increase in any node > 1 cm or >/= 50% increase in other target lesions (e.g., splenic or hepatic nodules) and/or any new bone marrow involvement and/or any new lesion > 1.5 cm or >/= 50% increase in any previously involved node with a diameter </= 1 cm such that it is now >1.5 cm. A participant in the Rituximab+CHOP arm with the longest follow-up, 53 months, had an event. The criterion for median was the minimum time when survival went below 50%.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants, of which evaluable participants were included in this analysis.

measurement_list.measurement: There were not enough events to calculate the confidence intervals.
There were not enough events to calculate the median and the upper limit of the confidence interval.

outcome.title: Time to Next Anti-Lymphoma Treatment (TTNALT)
outcome.description: Time to next anti-lymphoma treatment was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the start date of the next anti-lymphoma treatment or death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to start of next anti-lymphoma treatment or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first, to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Time to Next Anti-Lymphoma Treatment (TTNALT)
measure.description: Time to next anti-lymphoma treatment was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the start date of the next anti-lymphoma treatment or death from any cause.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

measurement_list.measurement: Median and 95% confidence interval were not calculable, due to low number of observations.
Median and 95% confidence interval were not calculable, due to low number of observations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with the treatment. An adverse event can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding, for example), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a pharmaceutical product, whether or not considered related to the pharmaceutical product. Preexisting conditions which worsen during a study are also considered as adverse events.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to data cut-off (up to approximately 4 years and 9 months)
outcome.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with the treatment. An adverse event can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding, for example), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a pharmaceutical product, whether or not considered related to the pharmaceutical product. Preexisting conditions which worsen during a study are also considered as adverse events.
measure.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Human Anti-Human Antibodies (HAHAs) to Obinutuzumab
outcome.description: The presence of HAHAs to obinutuzumab was assessed in the first 100 randomized participants.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (Hour 0) on Cycle (C) 1 Day (D) 1, C4D1, at end of treatment/early termination (up to Month 6), every 6 months thereafter for 30 months (cycle length = 21 days)
outcome.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Human Anti-Human Antibodies (HAHAs) to Obinutuzumab
measure.description: The presence of HAHAs to obinutuzumab was assessed in the first 100 randomized participants.
measure.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lymphoma (FACT-Lym) Subscale Score
outcome.description: The FACT-Lym subscale was developed to assess health-related quality of life in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. The score range is 0-60, with higher scores indicating better outcomes. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose [Hour 0] on C1D1), C3D1, end of treatment (up to Month 6), every 12 months thereafter up to data cut-off, up to approximately 4 years and 9 months, (cycle length = 21 days)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Lymphoma (FACT-Lym) Subscale Score
measure.description: The FACT-Lym subscale was developed to assess health-related quality of life in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. The score range is 0-60, with higher scores indicating better outcomes. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

measurement_list.measurement: There was only one reported value; therefore, no standard deviation.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) Domain Scores
outcome.description: The EORTC QLQ-C30 is a health-related quality of life questionnaire. A higher score indicates better quality of life, with changes of 5 to 10 points considered to be a minimally important difference to participants.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (pre-dose [Hour 0] on C1D1), C3D1, end of treatment (up to Month 6), every 12 months thereafter up to data cut-off, up to approximately 4 years and 9 months, (cycle length = 21 days)
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) Domain Scores
measure.description: The EORTC QLQ-C30 is a health-related quality of life questionnaire. A higher score indicates better quality of life, with changes of 5 to 10 points considered to be a minimally important difference to participants.
measure.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants.

outcome.title: Serum Concentrations of Obinutuzumab in Japanese Participants With Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL)
outcome.description: Serum samples for assessment of obinutuzumab serum concentrations were collected only from a subset of Japanese participants following administration of 1000 mg obinutuzumab.
outcome.time_frame: C1: D1 post-infusion and 20-28 and 66-80 hours after end of infusion, D8 and D15 pre-and post-infusion; C2: D1 pre- and post-infusion; C4: D1 pre- and post-infusion; C6: D1 pre- and post-infusion; C8: D1 pre- and post-infusion (cycle length = 21 days)
outcome.population: 40 Japanese participants in the Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy arm

group.title: Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Participants received an additional two doses of obinutuzumab on Days 8 and 15 of Cycle 1. Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

measure.title: Serum Concentrations of Obinutuzumab in Japanese Participants With Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL)
measure.description: Serum samples for assessment of obinutuzumab serum concentrations were collected only from a subset of Japanese participants following administration of 1000 mg obinutuzumab.
measure.population: 40 Japanese participants in the Obinutuzumab+Chemotherapy arm

reported_events.desc: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug (i.e., obinutuzumab, rituximab, or CHOP).

group.title: Rituximab+Chemotherapy
group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of rituximab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). Prior to study start, study centers chose whether they planned to administer 6 or 8 cycles of CHOP chemotherapy.

group.description: Participants received eight 21-day cycles of obinutuzumab, combined with six or eight cycles of standard cyclophosphamide, doxorubicin, vincristine, and prednisone/prednisolone (CHOP) chemotherapy (21-day cycles). category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
